tip.cred1: Sign up for an account on Dropbox.
tip.cred2: Create a new app on Dropbox developer home. On the subsequent page, select 'Dropbox API app' and choose App folder or Full Dropbox access. And set the required app permissions.
tip.cred3: On the same page, the 'app key' is displayed.  Copy that key and paste it into the box above.
tip.cred4: And on the same page, add the redirect url
tip.cred5: To obtain a new refresh token, start the (OAuth2) authentication flow.
tip.cred6: If no popup window appears, it might be necessary to instruct the browser to allow popup windows for this website.
tip.cred7: Since the refresh token doesn't expire, this step needs to be executed only once.  But if required, it can be repeated afterwards.
tip.cred8: The first time the authentication flow is executed, Dropbox will ask to confirm (via two subsequent pages) that this app has access to your Dropbox files.
tip.cred9: After the authentication flow has ended, the refresh token will be displayed in the popup window.  Copy that token and paste it into the box above.
tip.cred10: Every time the app permissions are changed afterwards, it is required to revoke the refresh token and to repeat steps 5 and 6 again. Otherwise the refresh token will continue operating with the original permissions.
